00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Interface to the Level 2 Cache (L2C) control, measurement, and debugging
00044  * facilities.
00045  *
00046  * <hr>$Revision: 159148 $<hr>
00047  *
00048  */
00049 
00050 #ifndef __CVMX_L2C_H__
00051 #define __CVMX_L2C_H__
00052 
00053 #define CVMX_L2C_IDX_ADDR_SHIFT 7   /* based on 128 byte cache line size */
00054 #define CVMX_L2C_IDX_MASK       (cvmx_l2c_get_num_sets() - 1)
00055 
00056 /* Defines for index aliasing computations */
00057 #define CVMX_L2C_TAG_ADDR_ALIAS_SHIFT (CVMX_L2C_IDX_ADDR_SHIFT + cvmx_l2c_get_set_bits())
00058 #define CVMX_L2C_ALIAS_MASK (CVMX_L2C_IDX_MASK << CVMX_L2C_TAG_ADDR_ALIAS_SHIFT)
00059 #define CVMX_L2C_MEMBANK_SELECT_SIZE  4096
00060 
00061 /* Maximium number of TADs */
00062 #define CVMX_L2C_MAX_TADS     8
00063 /* Maximium number of L2C performance counters */
00064 #define CVMX_L2C_MAX_PCNT     4
00065 
00066 /* Number of L2C Tag-and-data sections (TADs) that are connected to LMC. */
00067 #define CVMX_L2C_TADS  ((OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN68XX) \
00068                  || OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) \
00069              || OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX)) ? 4 : \
00070                 (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX)) ? 8 : 1)
00071 /* Number of L2C IOBs connected to LMC. */
00072 #define CVMX_L2C_IOBS  ((OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN68XX) \
00073              || OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX) \
00074              || OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) \
00075              || OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX)) ? 2 : 1)
00076 
00077 /* Defines for Virtualizations, valid only from Octeon II onwards. */
00078 #define CVMX_L2C_VRT_MAX_VIRTID_ALLOWED ((OCTEON_IS_OCTEON2()) ? 64 : 0)
00079 #define CVMX_L2C_MAX_MEMSZ_ALLOWED (((OCTEON_IS_OCTEON2() \
00080                       || OCTEON_IS_OCTEON3()) \
00081                     ? 32 : 0) * (CVMX_L2C_TADS))
00082 
00083   /*------------*/
00084   /*  TYPEDEFS  */
00085   /*------------*/
00086 union cvmx_l2c_tag {
00087     uint64_t u64;
00088 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00089     struct {
00090         uint64_t reserved:28;
00091         uint64_t V:1;   /* Line valid */
00092         uint64_t D:1;   /* Line dirty */
00093         uint64_t L:1;   /* Line locked */
00094         uint64_t U:1;   /* Use, LRU eviction */
00095         uint64_t addr:32;   /* Phys mem (not all bits valid) */
00096     } s;
00097 #else
00098     struct {
00099         uint64_t addr:32;   /* Phys mem (not all bits valid) */
00100         uint64_t U:1;   /* Use, LRU eviction */
00101         uint64_t L:1;   /* Line locked */
00102         uint64_t D:1;   /* Line dirty */
00103         uint64_t V:1;   /* Line valid */
00104         uint64_t reserved:28;
00105     } s;
00106 
00107 #endif
00108 };
00109 typedef union cvmx_l2c_tag cvmx_l2c_tag_t;
00110 
00111   /* L2C Performance Counter events for Octeon1(Plus) */
00112 enum cvmx_l2c_event {
00113     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_CYCLES = 0,       /**< Cycles */
00114     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_INSTRUCTION_MISS = 1,     /**< L2 Instruction Miss */
00115     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_INSTRUCTION_HIT = 2,  /**< L2 Instruction Hit */
00116     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_DATA_MISS = 3,        /**< L2 Data Miss */
00117     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_DATA_HIT = 4,         /**< L2 Data Hit */
00118     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_MISS = 5,         /**< L2 Miss (I/D) */
00119     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_HIT = 6,          /**< L2 Hit (I/D) */
00120     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_VICTIM_HIT = 7,       /**< L2 Victim Buffer Hit (Retry Probe) */
00121     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_INDEX_CONFLICT = 8,   /**< LFB-NQ Index Conflict */
00122     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_TAG_PROBE = 9,        /**< L2 Tag Probe (issued - could be VB-Retried) */
00123     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_TAG_UPDATE = 10,      /**< L2 Tag Update (completed). Note: Some CMD types do not update */
00124     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_TAG_COMPLETE = 11,    /**< L2 Tag Probe Completed (beyond VB-RTY window) */
00125     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_TAG_DIRTY = 12,       /**< L2 Tag Dirty Victim */
00126     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_DATA_STORE_NOP = 13,  /**< L2 Data Store NOP */
00127     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_DATA_STORE_READ = 14,     /**< L2 Data Store READ */
00128     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_DATA_STORE_WRITE = 15,    /**< L2 Data Store WRITE */
00129     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_FILL_DATA_VALID = 16,     /**< Memory Fill Data valid */
00130     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_WRITE_REQUEST = 17,   /**< Memory Write Request */
00131     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_READ_REQUEST = 18,    /**< Memory Read Request */
00132     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_WRITE_DATA_VALID = 19,    /**< Memory Write Data valid */
00133     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_XMC_NOP = 20,         /**< XMC NOP */
00134     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_XMC_LDT = 21,         /**< XMC LDT */
00135     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_XMC_LDI = 22,         /**< XMC LDI */
00136     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_XMC_LDD = 23,         /**< XMC LDD */
00137     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_XMC_STF = 24,         /**< XMC STF */
00138     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_XMC_STT = 25,         /**< XMC STT */
00139     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_XMC_STP = 26,         /**< XMC STP */
00140     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_XMC_STC = 27,         /**< XMC STC */
00141     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_XMC_DWB = 28,         /**< XMC DWB */
00142     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_XMC_PL2 = 29,         /**< XMC PL2 */
00143     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_XMC_PSL1 = 30,        /**< XMC PSL1 */
00144     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_XMC_IOBLD = 31,       /**< XMC IOBLD */
00145     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_XMC_IOBST = 32,       /**< XMC IOBST */
00146     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_XMC_IOBDMA = 33,      /**< XMC IOBDMA */
00147     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_XMC_IOBRSP = 34,      /**< XMC IOBRSP */
00148     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_XMC_BUS_VALID = 35,   /**< XMC Bus valid (all) */
00149     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_XMC_MEM_DATA = 36,    /**< XMC Bus valid (DST=L2C) Memory */
00150     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_XMC_REFL_DATA = 37,   /**< XMC Bus valid (DST=IOB) REFL Data */
00151     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_XMC_IOBRSP_DATA = 38,     /**< XMC Bus valid (DST=PP) IOBRSP Data */
00152     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_RSC_NOP = 39,         /**< RSC NOP */
00153     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_RSC_STDN = 40,        /**< RSC STDN */
00154     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_RSC_FILL = 41,        /**< RSC FILL */
00155     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_RSC_REFL = 42,        /**< RSC REFL */
00156     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_RSC_STIN = 43,        /**< RSC STIN */
00157     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_RSC_SCIN = 44,        /**< RSC SCIN */
00158     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_RSC_SCFL = 45,        /**< RSC SCFL */
00159     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_RSC_SCDN = 46,        /**< RSC SCDN */
00160     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_RSC_DATA_VALID = 47,  /**< RSC Data Valid */
00161     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_RSC_VALID_FILL = 48,  /**< RSC Data Valid (FILL) */
00162     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_RSC_VALID_STRSP = 49,     /**< RSC Data Valid (STRSP) */
00163     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_RSC_VALID_REFL = 50,  /**< RSC Data Valid (REFL) */
00164     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_LRF_REQ = 51,         /**< LRF-REQ (LFB-NQ) */
00165     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_DT_RD_ALLOC = 52,     /**< DT RD-ALLOC */
00166     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_DT_WR_INVAL = 53,     /**< DT WR-INVAL */
00167     CVMX_L2C_EVENT_MAX
00168 };
00169 typedef enum cvmx_l2c_event cvmx_l2c_event_t;
00170 
00171 /* L2C TAD Performance Counter events for Octeon2/3. */
00172 enum cvmx_l2c_tad_event {
00173     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_NONE = 0,    /* None */
00174     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_TAG_HIT = 1, /* L2 Tag Hit */
00175     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_TAG_MISS = 2,    /* L2 Tag Miss */
00176     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_TAG_NOALLOC = 3, /* L2 Tag NoAlloc (forced no-allocate) */
00177     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_TAG_VICTIM = 4,  /* L2 Tag Victim */
00178     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_SC_FAIL = 5, /* SC Fail */
00179     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_SC_PASS = 6, /* SC Pass */
00180     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_LFB_VALID = 7,   /* LFB Occupancy (each cycle adds \# of LFBs valid) */
00181     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_LFB_WAIT_LFB = 8,    /* LFB Wait LFB (each cycle adds \# LFBs waiting for other LFBs) */
00182     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_LFB_WAIT_VAB = 9,    /* LFB Wait VAB (each cycle adds \# LFBs waiting for VAB) */
00183     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD0_INDEX = 128,   /* Quad 0 index bus inuse */
00184     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD0_READ = 129,    /* Quad 0 read data bus inuse */
00185     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD0_BANK = 130,    /* Quad 0 \# banks inuse (0-4/cycle) */
00186     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD0_WDAT = 131,    /* Quad 0 wdat flops inuse (0-4/cycle) */
00187     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD1_INDEX = 144,   /* Quad 1 index bus inuse */
00188     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD1_READ = 145,    /* Quad 1 read data bus inuse */
00189     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD1_BANK = 146,    /* Quad 1 \# banks inuse (0-4/cycle) */
00190     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD1_WDAT = 147,    /* Quad 1 wdat flops inuse (0-4/cycle) */
00191     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD2_INDEX = 160,   /* Quad 2 index bus inuse */
00192     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD2_READ = 161,    /* Quad 2 read data bus inuse */
00193     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD2_BANK = 162,    /* Quad 2 \# banks inuse (0-4/cycle) */
00194     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD2_WDAT = 163,    /* Quad 2 wdat flops inuse (0-4/cycle) */
00195     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD3_INDEX = 176,   /* Quad 3 index bus inuse */
00196     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD3_READ = 177,    /* Quad 3 read data bus inuse */
00197     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD3_BANK = 178,    /* Quad 3 \# banks inuse (0-4/cycle) */
00198     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD3_WDAT = 179,    /* Quad 3 wdat flops inuse (0-4/cycle) */
00199     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD4_INDEX = 192,   /* Quad 4 index bus inuse */
00200     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD4_READ = 193,    /* Quad 4 read data bus inuse */
00201     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD4_BANK = 194,    /* Quad 4 \# banks inuse (0-4/cycle) */
00202     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD4_WDAT = 195,    /* Quad 4 wdat flops inuse (0-4/cycle) */
00203     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD5_INDEX = 208,   /* Quad 5 index bus inuse */
00204     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD5_READ = 209,    /* Quad 5 read data bus inuse */
00205     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD5_BANK = 210,    /* Quad 5 \# banks inuse (0-4/cycle) */
00206     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD5_WDAT = 211,    /* Quad 5 wdat flops inuse (0-4/cycle) */
00207     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD6_INDEX = 224,   /* Quad 6 index bus inuse */
00208     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD6_READ = 225,    /* Quad 6 read data bus inuse */
00209     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD6_BANK = 226,    /* Quad 6 \# banks inuse (0-4/cycle) */
00210     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD6_WDAT = 227,    /* Quad 6 wdat flops inuse (0-4/cycle) */
00211     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD7_INDEX = 240,   /* Quad 7 index bus inuse */
00212     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD7_READ = 241,    /* Quad 7 read data bus inuse */
00213     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD7_BANK = 242,    /* Quad 7 \# banks inuse (0-4/cycle) */
00214     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_QUAD7_WDAT = 243,    /* Quad 7 wdat flops inuse (0-4/cycle) */
00215     CVMX_L2C_TAD_EVENT_MAX
00216 };
00217 typedef enum cvmx_l2c_tad_event cvmx_l2c_tad_event_t;
00218 
00219 /**
00220  * Configure one of the four L2 Cache performance counters to capture event
00221  * occurences.
00222  *
00223  * @param counter        The counter to configure. Range 0..3.
00224  * @param event          The type of L2 Cache event occurrence to count.
00225  * @param clear_on_read  When asserted, any read of the performance counter
00226  *                       clears the counter.
00227  *
00228  * @note The routine does not clear the counter.
00229  */
00230 void cvmx_l2c_config_perf(uint32_t counter, cvmx_l2c_event_t event, uint32_t clear_on_read);
00231 
00232 /**
00233  * Read the given L2 Cache performance counter. The counter must be configured
00234  * before reading, but this routine does not enforce this requirement.
00235  *
00236  * @param counter  The counter to configure. Range 0..3.
00237  *
00238  * @return The current counter value.
00239  */
00240 uint64_t cvmx_l2c_read_perf(uint32_t counter);
00241 
00242 /**
00243  * Return the L2 Cache way partitioning for a given core.
00244  *
00245  * @param core  The core processor of interest.
00246  *
00247  * @return    The mask specifying the partitioning. 0 bits in mask indicates
00248  *              the cache 'ways' that a core can evict from.
00249  *            -1 on error
00250  */
00251 int cvmx_l2c_get_core_way_partition(uint32_t core);
00252 
00253 /**
00254  * Partitions the L2 cache for a core
00255  *
00256  * @param core The core that the partitioning applies to.
00257  * @param mask The partitioning of the ways expressed as a binary
00258  *             mask. A 0 bit allows the core to evict cache lines from
00259  *             a way, while a 1 bit blocks the core from evicting any
00260  *             lines from that way. There must be at least one allowed
00261  *             way (0 bit) in the mask.
00262  *
00263 
00264  * @note If any ways are blocked for all cores and the HW blocks, then
00265  *       those ways will never have any cache lines evicted from them.
00266  *       All cores and the hardware blocks are free to read from all
00267  *       ways regardless of the partitioning.
00268  */
00269 int cvmx_l2c_set_core_way_partition(uint32_t core, uint32_t mask);
00270 
00271 /**
00272  * Return the L2 Cache way partitioning for the hw blocks.
00273  *
00274  * @return    The mask specifying the reserved way. 0 bits in mask indicates
00275  *              the cache 'ways' that a core can evict from.
00276  *            -1 on error
00277  */
00278 int cvmx_l2c_get_hw_way_partition(void);
00279 
00280 /**
00281  * Partitions the L2 cache for the hardware blocks.
00282  *
00283  * @param mask The partitioning of the ways expressed as a binary
00284  *             mask. A 0 bit allows the core to evict cache lines from
00285  *             a way, while a 1 bit blocks the core from evicting any
00286  *             lines from that way. There must be at least one allowed
00287  *             way (0 bit) in the mask.
00288  *
00289 
00290  * @note If any ways are blocked for all cores and the HW blocks, then
00291  *       those ways will never have any cache lines evicted from them.
00292  *       All cores and the hardware blocks are free to read from all
00293  *       ways regardless of the partitioning.
00294  */
00295 int cvmx_l2c_set_hw_way_partition(uint32_t mask);
00296 
00297 /**
00298  * Return the L2 Cache way partitioning for the second set of hw blocks.
00299  *
00300  * @return    The mask specifying the reserved way. 0 bits in mask indicates
00301  *              the cache 'ways' that a core can evict from.
00302  *            -1 on error
00303  */
00304 int cvmx_l2c_get_hw_way_partition2(void);
00305 
00306 /**
00307  * Partitions the L2 cache for the second set of  blocks.
00308  *
00309  * @param mask The partitioning of the ways expressed as a binary
00310  *             mask. A 0 bit allows the core to evict cache lines from
00311  *             a way, while a 1 bit blocks the core from evicting any
00312  *             lines from that way. There must be at least one allowed
00313  *             way (0 bit) in the mask.
00314  *
00315 
00316  * @note If any ways are blocked for all cores and the HW blocks, then
00317  *       those ways will never have any cache lines evicted from them.
00318  *       All cores and the hardware blocks are free to read from all
00319  *       ways regardless of the partitioning.
00320  */
00321 int cvmx_l2c_set_hw_way_partition2(uint32_t mask);
00322 
00323 /**
00324  * Locks a line in the L2 cache at the specified physical address
00325  *
00326  * @param addr   physical address of line to lock
00327  *
00328  * @return 0 on success,
00329  *         1 if line not locked.
00330  */
00331 int cvmx_l2c_lock_line(uint64_t addr);
00332 
00333 /**
00334  * Locks a specified memory region in the L2 cache.
00335  *
00336  * Note that if not all lines can be locked, that means that all
00337  * but one of the ways (associations) available to the locking
00338  * core are locked.  Having only 1 association available for
00339  * normal caching may have a significant adverse affect on performance.
00340  * Care should be taken to ensure that enough of the L2 cache is left
00341  * unlocked to allow for normal caching of DRAM.
00342  *
00343  * @param start  Physical address of the start of the region to lock
00344  * @param len    Length (in bytes) of region to lock
00345  *
00346  * @return Number of requested lines that where not locked.
00347  *         0 on success (all locked)
00348  */
00349 int cvmx_l2c_lock_mem_region(uint64_t start, uint64_t len);
00350 
00351 /**
00352  * Unlock and flush a cache line from the L2 cache.
00353  * IMPORTANT: Must only be run by one core at a time due to use
00354  * of L2C debug features.
00355  * Note that this function will flush a matching but unlocked cache line.
00356  * (If address is not in L2, no lines are flushed.)
00357  *
00358  * @param address Physical address to unlock
00359  *
00360  * @return 0: line not unlocked
00361  *         1: line unlocked
00362  */
00363 int cvmx_l2c_unlock_line(uint64_t address);
00364 
00365 /**
00366  * Unlocks a region of memory that is locked in the L2 cache
00367  *
00368  * @param start  start physical address
00369  * @param len    length (in bytes) to unlock
00370  *
00371  * @return Number of locked lines that the call unlocked
00372  */
00373 int cvmx_l2c_unlock_mem_region(uint64_t start, uint64_t len);
00374 
00375 /**
00376  * Read the L2 controller tag for a given location in L2
00377  *
00378  * @param association
00379  *               Which association to read line from
00380  * @param index  Which way to read from.
00381  *
00382  * @return l2c tag structure for line requested.
00383  *
00384  * NOTE: This function is deprecated and cannot be used on devices with
00385  *       multiple L2C interfaces such as the OCTEON CN68XX.
00386  *       Please use cvmx_l2c_get_tag_v2 instead.
00387  */
00388 cvmx_l2c_tag_t cvmx_l2c_get_tag(uint32_t association, uint32_t index);
00389 cvmx_l2c_tag_t cvmx_l2c_get_tag(uint32_t association, uint32_t index)
00390     __attribute__ ((deprecated));
00391 
00392 /**
00393  * Read the L2 controller tag for a given location in L2
00394  *
00395  * @param association
00396  *               Which association to read line from
00397  * @param index  Which way to read from.
00398  *
00399  * @param tad    Which TAD to read from, set to 0 except on OCTEON CN68XX.
00400  *
00401  * @return l2c tag structure for line requested.
00402  */
00403 cvmx_l2c_tag_t cvmx_l2c_get_tag_v2(uint32_t association, uint32_t index, uint32_t tad);
00404 
00405 /**
00406  * Find the TAD for the specified address
00407  *
00408  * @param addr   physical address to get TAD for
00409  *
00410  * @return TAD number for address.
00411  */
00412 int cvmx_l2c_address_to_tad(uint64_t addr);
00413 
00414 /**
00415  * Returns the cache index for a given physical address
00416  *
00417  * @param addr   physical address
00418  *
00419  * @return L2 cache index
00420  */
00421 uint32_t cvmx_l2c_address_to_index(uint64_t addr);
00422 
00423 /**
00424  * Decodes TQD L2D single and double-bit errors to the appropriate cache index
00425  * for the CVMX_CACHE_LTGL2I operation.
00426  *
00427  * @param   node    CPU node number
00428  * @param   tad TAD interface
00429  *
00430  * @return  index address to pass to the LTGL2I cache operation (3)
00431  */
00432 uint64_t cvmx_l2c_tqdl2d_to_index_7xxx(int node, int tad);
00433 
00434 /**
00435  * Decodes TTG tag single and double-bit errors to the appropriate cache index
00436  * for the CVMX_CACHE_LTGL2I operation.
00437  *
00438  * @param   node    CPU node number
00439  * @param   tad TAD interface
00440  * @param   remote  true for remote tag index (78XX only)
00441  *
00442  * @return  index address to pass to the LTGL2I cache operation (3)
00443  *
00444  * TODO: This code needs to be corrected or validated.
00445  */
00446 uint64_t cvmx_l2c_ttgx_to_index_7xxx(int node, int tad, bool remote);
00447 
00448 /**
00449  * Returns the L2 tag that will be used for the given physical address
00450  *
00451  * @param addr   physical address
00452  * @return L2 cache tag. Addreses in the LMC hole are not valid.
00453  * Returns 0xFFFFFFFF if the address specified is in the LMC hole.
00454  */
00455 uint32_t cvmx_l2c_v2_address_to_tag(uint64_t addr);
00456 
00457 /**
00458  * Flushes (and unlocks) the entire L2 cache.
00459  * IMPORTANT: Must only be run by one core at a time due to use
00460  * of L2C debug features.
00461  */
00462 void cvmx_l2c_flush(void);
00463 
00464 /**
00465  * Flushes (and unlocks) the entire L2 cache.  Unlike cvmx_l2c_flush this
00466  * function also flushes and unlocks the remote L2 cache.
00467  * IMPORTANT: Must only be run by one core at a time due to use
00468  * of L2C debug features.
00469  */
00470 void cvmx_l2c_flush_ocx(void);
00471 
00472 /**
00473  *
00474  * @return Returns the size of the L2 cache in bytes,
00475  * -1 on error (unrecognized model)
00476  */
00477 int cvmx_l2c_get_cache_size_bytes(void);
00478 
00479 /**
00480  * Return the number of sets in the L2 Cache
00481  *
00482  * @return
00483  */
00484 int cvmx_l2c_get_num_sets(void);
00485 
00486 /**
00487  * Return log base 2 of the number of sets in the L2 cache
00488  * @return
00489  */
00490 int cvmx_l2c_get_set_bits(void);
00491 
00492 /**
00493  * Return the number of associations in the L2 Cache
00494  *
00495  * @return
00496  */
00497 int cvmx_l2c_get_num_assoc(void);
00498 
00499 /**
00500  * Flush a line from the L2 cache
00501  * This should only be called from one core at a time, as this routine
00502  * sets the core to the 'debug' core in order to flush the line.
00503  *
00504  * @param assoc  Association (or way) to flush
00505  * @param index  Index to flush
00506  */
00507 void cvmx_l2c_flush_line(uint32_t assoc, uint32_t index);
00508 
00509 /**
00510  * Initialize the BIG address in L2C+DRAM to generate proper error
00511  * on reading/writing to an non-existant memory location.
00512  *
00513  * @param mem_size  Amount of DRAM configured in MB.
00514  * @param mode      Allow/Disallow reporting errors L2C_INT_SUM[BIGRD,BIGWR].
00515  */
00516 void cvmx_l2c_set_big_size(uint64_t mem_size, int mode);
00517 
00518 /**
00519  * Initialize the BIG address in L2C+DRAM to generate proper error
00520  * on reading/writing to an non-existant memory location.
00521  *
00522  * @param node      OCX CPU node number
00523  * @param mem_size  Amount of DRAM configured in MB.
00524  * @param mode      Allow/Disallow reporting errors L2C_INT_SUM[BIGRD,BIGWR].
00525  */
00526 void cvmx_l2c_set_big_size_node(int node, uint64_t mem_size, int mode);

00529 
00530 /*
00531  * Set maxium number of Virtual IDS allowed in a machine.
00532  *
00533  * @param nvid  Number of virtial ids allowed in a machine.
00534  * @return      Return 0 on success or -1 on failure.
00535  */
00536 int cvmx_l2c_vrt_set_max_virtids(int nvid);
00537 
00538 /**
00539  * Get maxium number of virtual IDs allowed in a machine.
00540  *
00541  * @return  Return number of virtual machine IDs. Return -1 on failure.
00542  */
00543 int cvmx_l2c_vrt_get_max_virtids(void);
00544 
00545 /**
00546  * Set the maxium size of memory space to be allocated for virtualization.
00547  *
00548  * @param memsz     Size of the virtual memory in GB
00549  * @return          Return 0 on success or -1 on failure.
00550  */
00551 int cvmx_l2c_vrt_set_max_memsz(int memsz);
00552 
00553 /**
00554  * Set a Virtual ID to a set of cores.
00555  *
00556  * @param virtid    Assign virtid to a set of cores.
00557  * @param coremask  The group of cores to assign a unique virtual id.
00558  * @return          Return 0 on success, otherwise -1.
00559  */
00560 int cvmx_l2c_vrt_assign_virtid(int virtid, uint32_t coremask);
00561 
00562 /**
00563  * Remove a virt id assigned to a set of cores. Update the virtid mask and
00564  * virtid stored for each core.
00565  *
00566  * @param virtid  Remove the specified Virtualization machine ID.
00567  */
00568 void cvmx_l2c_vrt_remove_virtid(int virtid);
00569 
00570 /**
00571  * Block a memory region to be updated by a set of virtids.
00572  *
00573  * @param start_addr   Starting address of memory region
00574  * @param size         Size of the memory to protect
00575  * @param mode         Allow/Disallow write access
00576  *                        = 0,  Allow write access by virtid
00577  *                        = 1,  Disallow write access by virtid
00578  */
00579 int cvmx_l2c_vrt_memprotect(uint64_t start_addr, int size, int virtid, int mode);

00582  * Enable virtualization.
00583  */
00584 void cvmx_l2c_vrt_enable(int mode);
00585 
00586 /**
00587  * Disable virtualization.
00588  */
00589 void cvmx_l2c_vrt_disable(void);
